value.name: local
value.summary: Use the user accounts on the DataPower Gateway.

value.name: xmlfile
value.summary: Use an XML file on the DataPower Gateway.

value.name: ldap
value.summary: Contact an LDAP server.

value.name: radius
value.summary: Contact a RADIUS server.

value.name: spnego
value.summary: Use Windows Integrated Authentication.

value.name: zosnss
value.summary: Contact a z/OS NSS server.

value.name: custom
value.summary: Use a custom stylesheet.

value.name: client-ssl
value.summary: Use a TLS certificate from a connection peer.

value.description: Caches the results for the period of time that is specified by the cache lifetime. The lifetime is the explicit time-to-live (TTL).
value.name: absolute
value.summary: Use the explicit TTL

value.description: Disables caching. The system does not cache results.
value.name: disabled
value.summary: Disable

value.description: Compares the explicit TTL to the protocol TTL, if any. The effective TTL is the lesser of the two values. If the explicit TTL is 5 and the protocol TTL is 10, uses 5. Without a protocol TTL, equivalent to absolute.
value.name: maximum
value.summary: Use the configured TTL as the maximum possible TTL

value.description: Compares the explicit TTL to the protocol TTL, if any. The effective TTL is the greater of the two values. If the explicit TTL is 5 and the protocol TTL is 10, uses 10. Without a protocol TTL, the effective TTL is 86400.
value.name: minimum
value.summary: Use the configured TTL as the minimum possible TTL

value.name: local
value.summary: Use the user group on the DataPower Gateway.

value.name: xmlfile
value.summary: Use an XML file on the DataPower Gateway.

value.name: custom
value.summary: Use a custom stylesheet.

value.name: v2
value.summary: LDAP v2

value.name: v3
value.summary: LDAP v3

value.name: disabled
value.summary: No local user accounts can log in.

value.name: local
value.summary: All local user accounts can log in.

value.name: restricted
value.summary: Only the defined subset of local user accounts can log in.

type.description: The hash algorithm used for user account passwords.
type.name: dmPasswordFileHashAlgorithm

object.name: RBMSettings

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
A descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.name: UserSummary
AUMethod
property.summary: Set the method to authenticate users.
property.description: The method to authenticate users.

property.name: AUZOSNSSConfig
property.summary: Set the local NSS client that defines how to connect to the NSS server for SAF communication.
property.description: The local NSS client that defines how to connect to the NSS server for SAF communication.

property.name: AUKerberosKeytab
property.summary: Set the Kerberos keytab with the server principal to decrypt client tickets.
property.description: The Kerberos keytab with the server principal to decrypt client tickets.

property.name: AUCustomURL
property.summary: Enter the URL of custom stylesheet.
property.description: The URL of custom stylesheet.

property.name: AUInfoURL
property.summary: Enter the URL of the XML file for authentication.
property.description: The URL of the XML file for authentication. The XML file can be on the DataPower Gateway or on a remote server. You can use the same XML file to map credentials.

property.name: AUSSLValcred
property.summary: Set the validation credentials to authenticate user certificates from TLS peers.
property.description: The validation credentials to authenticate user certificates from TLS peers during the TLS handshake.

property.name: AUHost
property.summary: Enter the host name or IP address of the server.
property.description: The host name or IP address of the server.

property.name: AUPort
property.summary: Enter the listening port on the server.
property.description: The listening port on the server.

property.name: AULDAPSearchForDN
property.summary: Indicate whether to retrieve the user DN with an LDAP search.
property.description: <p>Whether to retrieve the user DN with an LDAP search.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the login name presented by the user is used with the LDAP search parameters for an LDAP search to retrieve the user DN.</li><li>When disabled, the login name presented by the user is used with the LDAP prefix and suffix to construct the user DN.</li></ul>

property.name: AULDAPBindDN
property.summary: Enter the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Enter the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPBindPasswordAlias
property.summary: Enter the password alias for the password used by the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The password alias for the password used by the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPSearchParameters
property.summary: Set the LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.
property.description: The LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPPrefix
property.summary: Enter the string to add before the user name to form the DN.
property.description: <p>The string to add before the user name to form the DN. If this value is <tt>CN=</tt> and the user name is <tt>Bob</tt> , the complete DN is <tt>CN=Bob,O=example.com</tt> when the LDAP suffix is <tt>O=example.com</tt> .</p>

property.name: AUForceDNLDAPOrder
property.summary: Indicate whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format.
property.description: <p>Whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format. This property is essential when the extracted DN from a TLS certificate is in X.500 format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from left to right with forward slashes as separators; for example, <tt>C=US/O=My Organization/CN=Fred</tt> .</p><p>When you retrieve the group name with an LDAP search, the authenticated DN must be in LDAP format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from right to left with commas as separators; for example, <tt>CN=Fred, O=My Organization, C=US</tt> .</p>

property.name: LDAPsuffix
property.summary: Enter the string to add after the user name to form the DN.
property.description: <p>The string to add after the user name to form the DN. If this value is <tt>O=example.com</tt> and the user name is <tt>Bob</tt> , the complete DN is <tt>CN=Bob,O=example.com</tt> when the LDAP prefix is <tt>CN=</tt> .</p>

property.name: LDAPSSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile to secure the connection with the LDAP server.

property.name: AULDAPLoadBalanceGroup
property.summary: Set the load balancer group of LDAP servers.
property.description: The load balancer group of LDAP servers. This setting overrides the settings for the server host and port.

property.name: AUCacheAllow
property.summary: Set how to cache authentication results.
property.description: How to cache authentication results.

property.name: AUCacheTTL
property.summary: Enter the expiry for cached authentication decisions.
property.description: The expiry for cached authentication decisions. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 600.

property.name: AULDAPReadTimeout
property.summary: Enter the time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the connection.
property.description: The time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the LDAP connection. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 60. A value of 0 indicates that the connection never times out.

property.name: MCMethod
property.summary: Set the method to map authenticated user credentials to access profiles.
property.description: The method to map authenticated user credentials to access profiles.

property.name: MCCustomURL
property.summary: Enter the URL of custom stylesheet.
property.description: The URL of custom stylesheet.

property.name: MCLDAPSearchForGroup
property.summary: Indicate whether to search LDAP to retrieve all user groups that match the query.
property.description: <p>Whether to search LDAP to retrieve all user groups that match the query.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the authenticated DN of the user and the LDAP search parameters are used as part of the LDAP search to retrieve all user groups that match the query. When a user belongs to multiple groups, the resultant access policy for this user is additive not most restrictive.</li><li>When disabled, the authenticated identity of the user (DN or user group of local user) is used directly as the input credential.</li></ul>

property.name: MCHost
property.summary: Enter the host name or IP address of the server.
property.description: The host name or IP address of the server.

property.name: MCPort
property.summary: Enter the listening port on the server.
property.description: The listening port on the server.

property.name: MCLDAPSSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile to secure the connection with the LDAP server.

property.name: MCLDAPLoadBalanceGroup
property.summary: Set the load balancer group of LDAP servers.
property.description: The load balancer group of LDAP servers.

property.name: MCLDAPBindDN
property.summary: Enter the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: MCLDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Enter the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: MCLDAPBindPasswordAlias
property.summary: Enter the password alias for the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
property.description: The password alias for the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: MCLDAPSearchParameters
property.summary: Set the LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.
property.description: The LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.

property.name: MCInfoURL
property.summary: Enter the URL of the XML file to map credentials.
property.description: The URL of the XML file to map credentials. The XML file can be on the DataPower Gateway or on a remote server. You can use the same XML file for authentication.

property.name: MCLDAPReadTimeout
property.summary: Enter the time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the connection.
property.description: The time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the LDAP connection. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 60. A value of 0 indicates that the connection never times out.

property.name: LDAPVersion
property.summary: Set the LDAP protocol version to use.
property.description: The LDAP protocol version to use.

property.name: FallbackLogin
property.summary: Indicate whether to use local user accounts as fallback users if remote authentication fails.
property.description: <p>Whether to use local user accounts as fallback users if remote authentication fails. With fallback users, local user accounts can log on to the DataPower Gateway if authentication fails or during a network outage that affects primary authentication. The recommendation is to restrict fallback users to a subset of local user accounts.</p><p><b>Note: </b>When authentication uses a TLS certificate from a connection peer, you cannot enforce RBM on CLI sessions unless fallback users are supported.</p>

property.name: FallbackUser
property.summary: Set the list of local user accounts that are fallback users.
property.description: The list of local user accounts that are fallback users.

property.name: ApplyToCLI
property.summary: Indicate whether to enforce the RBM policy on CLI sessions.
property.description: Whether to enforce the RBM policy on CLI sessions. When authentication uses a TLS certificate from a connection peer, you cannot enforce RBM on CLI sessions unless fallback users are supported.

property.name: RestrictAdminToSerialPort
property.summary: Indicate whether to restrict admin user account to serial port.
property.description: <p>Whether to restrict the <tt>admin</tt> user account to the serial port.</p>

property.name: MinPasswordLength
property.summary: Enter the minimum length of a valid password.
property.description: The minimum length of a valid password. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128. The default value is 6.

property.name: RequireMixedCase
property.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain both uppercase and lowercase characters.
property.description: Whether passwords must contain both uppercase and lowercase characters.

property.name: RequireDigit
property.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain at least one number.
property.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one number.

property.name: RequireNonAlphaNumeric
property.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain at least one special, non-alphanumeric character.
property.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one special, non-alphanumeric character.

property.name: DisallowUsernameSubstring
property.summary: Indicate whether passwords can never contain the user name as a substring.
property.description: Whether passwords can never contain the user name as a substring.

property.name: DoPasswordAging
property.summary: Indicates whether passwords expires.
property.description: Whether passwords expires.

property.name: MaxPasswordAge
property.summary: Enter the expiry for passwords.
description: The expiry for passwords Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 30.
Enter the expiry for passwords Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535.

property.name: DoPasswordHistory
property.summary: Indicates whether to control the reuse of recent passwords.
property.description: Whether to control the reuse of recent passwords.

property.name: NumOldPasswords
property.summary: Enter the number of recent passwords to track to prevent reuse.
property.description: The number of recent passwords to track to prevent reuse. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 5.

property.name: CliTimeout
property.summary: Enter the time after which to invalidate idle CLI sessions.
property.description: The time after which to invalidate idle CLI sessions. When invalidated, requires reauthentication. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 600. A value of 0 disables the timer.

property.name: MaxFailedLogin
property.summary: Enter the number of failed login attempts to allow before account lockout.
property.description: The number of failed login attempts to allow before account lockout. Enter a value in the range of 0 - 64, where 0 disables account lockout. The default value is 0.

property.name: LockoutPeriod
property.summary: Enter the duration to lock out local user accounts after the maximum number of failed login attempts is exceeded.
property.description: <p>The duration to lock out local user accounts after the maximum number of failed login attempts is exceeded. Instead of locking out accounts for a specific duration, the account can be locked out until re-enabled by a privileged user. Enter a value in the range 0 - 1000, where 0 locks out accounts until reset. The default value is 1.</p><p><b>Note:</b> The duration applies to all local accounts, including the <tt>admin</tt> user account. The only difference is that the <tt>admin</tt> user account cannot be locked out until reset. When the duration is 0, the <tt>admin</tt> user account is locked out for 120 minutes or until re-enabled by a privileged user.</p>

property.name: MCForceDNLDAPOrder
property.summary: Indicate whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format.
property.description: <p>Whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format. This property is essential when the extracted DN from a TLS certificate is in X.500 format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from left to right with forward slashes as separators; for example, <tt>C=US/O=My Organization/CN=Fred</tt> .</p><p>When you retrieve the group name with an LDAP search, the authenticated DN must be in LDAP format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from right to left with commas as separators; for example, <tt>CN=Fred, O=My Organization, C=US</tt> .</p>

property.name: PasswordHashAlgorithm
property.summary: Set the hash algorithm to apply to passwords.
property.description: <p>The hash algorithm to apply to passwords before they are stored. The hash algorithm affects firmware downgrade and cryptographic modes in the following ways.</p><ul><li>For firmware downgrade, sha256crypt is not supported in releases earlier than 6.0.1.0.</li><li>For cryptographic modes, like FIPS 140-2 Level 1, md5crypt is not supported in FIPS mode.</li></ul>

property.name: LDAPSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: LDAPSSLClientProfile
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: MCLDAPSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: MCLDAPSSLClientProfile
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

object.description: <p>Manage role-based management (RBM) settings: RBM, password policy, and account policy</p><ul><li>RBM consists of the following capabilities: Authenticating users, evaluating the access profile, enforcing access to resources</li><li>The password policy sets the password requirements for local user accounts.</li><li>The account policy sets the lockout behavior and the timeout for CLI sessions.</li></ul>
